com.googlecode.transmuter.core
Class Transmuter

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.transmuter.core.Transmuter

public class Transmuter
extends Object

The main object in the library. A transmuter provides a centralized type conversion operation, using registered converters. These converters may later be used when a conversion operation is made with matching types.

There cannot be more than one registered converter with the exact same type; the existing one must be explicitly unregistered before the new one is included.

Author:
Humberto S. N. dos Anjos

Nested Class Summary
protected static class Transmuter.ConverterMap
          A map used for converter registration, validating the prospective mapping before the actual insertion.
protected static class Transmuter.DependentConverterMap
          A Transmuter.ConverterMap which checks for collisions against itself and a master map.

Method Detail

convert

public <From,To> To convert(From from,
                            Class<To> toType)
Performs a conversion, taking from and generating a new object of type toType.

Due to erasure-imposed limitations, from's runtime class will be considered as the input type. This means that all the invocations below: 

 convert(new ArrayList<String>(), String.class);
 convert(new ArrayList<Map<java.util.Date, Set<Thread>>>>(), String.class);
 convert(new ArrayList(), String.class);
will attempt to use the same converter.

For parameterized input types, the appropriate input type should be specified.

Type Parameters:
From - the input type of the conversion.
To - the output type of the conversion.
Parameters:
from - the object to convert.
toType - the type of the converted object.
Returns:
an instance of toType.
Throws:
NoCompatibleConvertersFoundException - if no converters for from's type to toType were found.
TooManyConvertersFoundException - if more than one converter for from's type to toType was found.
IllegalArgumentException - if from or toType is null (or void for toType).
InvocationException - if there was an error during the converter's invocation.
See Also:
convert(Object, TypeToken, TypeToken)

convert

convert

public <From,To,SubFrom extends From> To convert(SubFrom from,
                                                 Class<From> fromType,
                                                 Class<To> toType)
Performs a conversion, taking from (which is considered to be of type fromType for the purposes of this operation) and generating a new object of type toType.

Type Parameters:
From - the input type of the conversion.
To - the output type of the conversion.
SubFrom - the actual type of the object to convert. Used only to ensure that from is a subtype of fromType.
Parameters:
from - the object to convert.
fromType - the type of the object to convert.
toType - the type of the converted object.
Returns:
an instance of toType.
Throws:
NoCompatibleConvertersFoundException - if no converters for fromType to toType were found.
TooManyConvertersFoundException - if more than one converter for fromType to toType was found.
IllegalArgumentException - if fromType or toType is null or void.
InvocationException - if there was an error during the converter's invocation.

convertRaw

protected Object convertRaw(Object from,
                            TypeToken<?> toType)
Performs a conversion, taking from and generating a new object of type toType.

This method doesn't use generics for compile-time checking, returning the result as a raw Object. So, due to erasure-imposed limitations, from's runtime class will be considered as the input type. This means that both invocations below: 

 convertRaw(new ArrayList<String>(), TypeToken.STRING);
 convertRaw(new ArrayList<Map<java.util.Date, Set<Thread>>>>(), TypeToken.STRING);
will attempt to use the same converter.

Parameters:
from - the object to convert.
toType - the type of the converted object.
Returns:
an instance of toType.
Throws:
NoCompatibleConvertersFoundException - if no converters for from's type to toType were found.
TooManyConvertersFoundException - if more than one converter for from's type to toType was found.
IllegalArgumentException - if from or toType is null (or void for toType).
InvocationException - if there was an error during the converter's invocation.

                            IllegalArgumentException,
                            InvocationException
Performs a conversion, taking from (which is considered to be of type fromType for the purposes of this operation) and generating a new object of type toType.

This method doesn't use generics for compile-time checking, returning the result as a raw Object.

IllegalArgumentException - if fromType or toType is null or void.
InvocationException - if there was an error during the converter's invocation.

register

public void register(Iterable<? extends Converter> converters)
              throws ConverterRegistrationException
Attempts to register all given converters in this instance, keyed by their types. Does nothing if the given iterable is null.

Delegates to tryRegister for the actual legwork, so subclasses which wish to alter the registration algorithm should override it instead of this method.

This method simply checks tryRegister's final report to determine if an exception must be thrown. The exception will hold all the problems found with the given arguments. In that case, no converters from converters will be registered, even if they're valid.

Parameters:
converters - a bundle of converters
Throws:
ConverterRegistrationException - if there is some error during the operation.
See Also:
tryRegister(Iterable)

tryRegister

protected Notification tryRegister(Iterable<? extends Converter> converters)
Registers all given converters in this instance, keyed by their types. Does nothing if the given iterable is null.

This method will iterate through all the converters and check if there is no registered converter with the same type, registering all the converters in one fell swoop if no problem is found.

This method returns a Notification object, which accumulates any problems verified here and reports the final status of the registration.

Parameters:
converters - a bundle of converters
Returns:
a Notification with all errors found during registration. Should not be null.
See Also:
Transmuter.DependentConverterMap

public Converter unregister(ConverterType converterType)
Unregisters the converter for the given converter type. Does nothing if no such converter exists.

Parameters:
converterType - a converter type.
Returns:
the converter previously associated with the given converter type, or null if there was no such converter.

getConverterFor

protected Converter getConverterFor(ConverterType converterType)
                             throws NoCompatibleConvertersFoundException,
                                    TooManyConvertersFoundException
Attempts to return a converter compatible with the given converter type.

There can only be one exact match registered in the transmuter, which will be returned here; lacking that, a compatible converter will be looked for. An exception will be thrown if no converter is found, or if more than one compatible (non-exact match) converter is found, since this method cannot decide which should be returned.

Parameters:
converterType - a converter type.
Returns:
a converter compatible with the given converter type. May not an exact match.
Throws:
NoCompatibleConvertersFoundException - no compatible converters were found.
TooManyConvertersFoundException - more than one compatible converter was found.

getCompatibleConvertersFor

protected Set<Converter> getCompatibleConvertersFor(ConverterType converterType)
Returns a set of all the converters registered in this instance which are compatible with the given converter type. Will be empty if the given converter type is null or has no compatible converters.

Parameters:
converterType - a converter type.
Returns:
a set with all the compatible converters found.

getConverterMap

protected Map<ConverterType,Converter> getConverterMap()
Returns a map holding all the registered converters, keyed by their converter types. This map is backed by this instance, i.e. changes made in this transmuter are seen in the map and vice-versa.

Returns:
a map holding all the registered converters, keyed by their converter types and backed by this instance.
